sentence: The recently updated portfolio of William "Bill" Ackman, CEO of Pershing Square Capital Management, lists eight stocks, none of them new, and a total value of $10.927 billion.
The fund's quarter-over-quarter turnover is 11%.
The portfolio's top sectors are weighted as: consumer defensive at 33.1%, industrials at 27.7% and basic materials at 21.3%.
According to the GuruFocus Scoreboard , Guru Bill Ackman is averaging a 12-month return of 7.38%.

Here are the most recent decreases in the Ackman portfolio, beginning with his major reduction of the Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd. ( CP ), which he also reduced in the third quarter of 2013, according to GuruFocus Real Time Picks .
Incorporated in 1881, Canadian Pacific Railroad reported its third quarter net income at $324 million, up by 45%.
The railroad's quarterly revenue was a record $1.5 billion, up 6% over last year.
In the third quarter of 2013, the company's adjusted net income was $331 million, up by 48%.
CP's record-breaking quarterly earnings were up 45% year-over-year at an adjusted EPS of $1.88.
Up 56% over 12 months, Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd. has a market cap of $25.12 billion; its shares with a P/E ratio of 35.80 and a P/B of 4.50.
The dividend yield is 0.95%.
Guru Action: As of Oct. 24, 2013, Bill Ackman reduced his position by 28.97%, selling shares in the average price range of $141.72.

Finally, in the third quarter of 2013, Bill Ackman sold out his stake in J.C. Penney Co. Inc. ( JCP ), unloading 39,075,771 shares at an average price of $14.26 per share, taking a loss of 36.7% after five quarters of double-digit losses.
